chapter_3_Streams

Class Recipe_3_6_Converting_Strings_to_Streams_and_Back

  • java.lang.Object
    • chapter_3_Streams.Recipe_3_6_Converting_Strings_to_Streams_and_Back

  • public class Recipe_3_6_Converting_Strings_to_Streams_and_Back
extends java.lang.Object

    (3.6.) Converting Strings to Streams and back


    1. TO DO

      - use the idiomatic Stream processing techniques instead of looping over individual characters of a String

    2. HOW

      - use CharSequence.chars() or CharSequence.codePoints() to convert a String to an IntStream. Convert back to a String using the IntStream.collect(Supplier, ObjIntConsumer, BiConsumer) method.
      (The difference between the two methods has to do with how Java handles UTF-16-encoded characters as opposed to the full Unicode set of code points)

    3. EQ.

      checkPalindromes() - run the two implementations of checking if a String is a palindrome
      • isPalindromeBeforeJava8(String) - the implementation before Java 8 (before Streams)
      • isPalindromeAfterJava8(String) - the implementationm using Streams

    String is not part of the Collection framework and it doesn't implement Iterable so there is no stream factory method to convert one to a stream.
    At the same time, in Arrays.stream there isn't an overloading for char[].

    Converting a stream of charcters back to a String can be done with Stream.collect(Collector) method, but there isn't a pre-defined Collector that will take a stream of characters and assemble it into a String.
    See Also:
    Recipe_4_9_Implementing_the_Collector_Interface

      • isPalindromeBeforeJava8

        protected static boolean isPalindromeBeforeJava8(java.lang.String string)
        ◊◊◊ Check Palindroms before Java 8 ◊◊◊ 
             StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
     for(char c : string.toCharArray()) {
        if(Character.isLetterOrDigit(c)) {
            sb.append(c);
        }
     }

     String forward = sb.toString().toLowerCase();
     String backward = sb.reverse().toString().toLowerCase();

     return forward.equals(backward);
        Parameters:
        string - the String to be checked
        Returns:
        the String si a palindrome or not

      • isPalindromeAfterJava8

        protected static boolean isPalindromeAfterJava8(java.lang.String string)
        ◊◊◊ Check Palindroms after Java 8 ◊◊◊ 
             String forward = string.toLowerCase().codePoints()
            .filter(Character::isLetterOrDigit)
            .collect(StringBuilder::new,
                     StringBuilder::appendCodePoint,
                     StringBuilder::append)
            .toString();

     String backward = new StringBuilder(forward).reverse().toString();

     return forward.equals(backward);
        Parameters:
        string - the String to be checked
        Returns:
        the String si a palindrome or not
